content: repeat row2 *row7 half_double_crochet in first stitch and in next desired number of stitches i did 13 stitches we will now start on a rip chain 3 skip 3 stitches half_double_crochet across until the last stitch chain 1 turn picture *row8 half_double_crochet in first stitch and in each stitch across until one stitch before chain leaving one stitch unworked before chain picture chain 5 skip 5 stitches half_double_crochet across until end of row chain 1 turn change color every 8 row *row9 with green yarn half_double_crochet in first stitch and in each across up to chain chain 7 skip 7 stitches half_double_crochet across until end of row chain 1 turn *row10 half_double_crochet in first stitch and in each stitch across until chain chain 7 skip 7 stitches half_double_crochet across until end chain 1 turn *row11 half_double_crochet in first stitch and in each stitch across until chain half_double_crochet in first chain chain 5 skip 5 stitches half_double_crochet across until the end chain 1 turn in each stitch across until end chain 1 turn *row12 half_double_crochet in first stitch and in each stitch across until chain half_double_crochet in first 2 chain chain 3 skip 3 stitches half_double_crochet across until the end chain 1 turn *row13 half_double_crochet in first stitch and in each stitch across including chain chain 1 turn rip complete row 14-16 half_double_crochet in first and in each stitch across until the end chain 1 turn change color row17 with red yarn half_double_crochet in first stitch and in each stitch across until the end chain 1 turn *row18-24 start at rip on row20 follow chain pa�ern starting from row7 until rip is complete half_double_crochet in each stitch across until end chain 1 turn change color row25-32 stitch across until the end chain 1 turn change color row49-56 half_double_crochet in first stitch and in each stitch across until the end chain1 turn *add more red and green stripes here to make cardigan longer just keep up with same pa�ern front panel make 2 -each front panel should measure half of the width of the back panel minus 4-6 inches space for neckhole so for example if your back panel measures 24 inches wide 24 minus 4inches =20 inches 20 inches divided in half is 10 inches so in this example each front panel should measure 10 inches wide your starting chain should measure 10 inches unstretched with red yarn crochet a chain long enough to match measurement above without stretching row1 half_double_crochet in first stitch and in each stitch across until the end chain 1 turn your stitch/chain count must remain the same in each row from
